title: I - Chords
stimulusHtml:
9 points

The solution above represents one of several possible excellent solutions.

Chords (9 points, 1 point per chord)

  1. Award 1 point for each chord that correctly realizes the given figured bass.

    1. All seventh chords must contain four voices.

    2. All triads must contain at least three voices.

    3. All inverted triads and seventh chords must be complete.

    4. The fifth may be omitted from any root-position chord.

  2. Award 1/2 point for correctly realized chords that have one of the following errors:

    1. an inappropriate doubling of a chordal seventh or a leading tone

    2. more than one octave between adjacent upper parts

  3. Award no points for correctly realized chords that have more than one error listed in section I. 2. You still must check the voice leading into and out of these chords.

  4. Award no points for incorrectly realized chords. You do not have to check the voice leading into and out of these chords.

title: II - Voice Leading
stimulusHtml:
16 Points

Voice leading (16 points, 2 points per connection)

  1. Award 2 points for good voice leading between two correctly realized chords.

    N.B. This includes the voice leading from the given chord to the second chord.

  2. Award only 1 point for voice leading between two correctly realized chords that features:

    1. hidden octaves or fifths between outer voices

    2. overlapping or crossed voices

    3. chordal sevenths that are not prepared by step or common tone unless they are part of a correctly used appoggiatura

  3. Award no points for voice leading between two correctly realized chords if:

    1. parallel or consecutive octaves or fifths occur

    2. uncharacteristic leaps occur (e.g., A2, tritone, or more than a fifth)

    3. the leading tone in an outer voice is unresolved or resolved incorrectly

    4. chordal sevenths are unresolved or resolved incorrectly

    5. one of the chords is a triad with only three voices

    6. more than one error listed in section II. 2. occurs

  4. Award no points for voice leading into and out of an incorrectly realized chord.

title: III. Roman Numerals
stimulusHtml:
Roman numerals (9 points, 1 point per numeral)

Award 1 point for each correct Roman numeral.

  1. Analyses that mix uppercase and lowercase numerals should not be penalized. Exception: The Roman numeral of chord five must be uppercase II to receive credit.

  2. Analyses that do not include Arabic numerals should not be penalized.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the following points:

Roman numerals (9 points, 1 point per numeral)

Award 1 point for each correct Roman numeral.

  1. Analyses that mix uppercase and lowercase numerals should not be penalized. Exception: The Roman numeral of chord five must be uppercase II to receive credit.

  2. Analyses that do not include Arabic numerals should not be penalized.

Student response earns 1 of the following points:

Roman numerals (9 points, 1 point per numeral)

Award 1 point for each correct Roman numeral.

  1. Analyses that mix uppercase and lowercase numerals should not be penalized. Exception: The Roman numeral of chord five must be uppercase II to receive credit.

  2. Analyses that do not include Arabic numerals should not be penalized.

title: IV. Scores with additional meaning
stimulusHtml:
Scores with additional meaning

0 Response demonstrates an attempt to answer the question but which has no redeeming qualities.
descriptions:
Scores with additional meaning

0 Response demonstrates an attempt to answer the question but which has no redeeming qualities.

title: V.Non-Chord Tones
stimulusHtml:
1. Do not penalize a response that includes correctly used non-chord tones.

  2. An incorrectly used non-chord tone should be considered a voice-leading error.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.

  1. Do not penalize a response that includes correctly used non-chord tones.

  2. An incorrectly used non-chord tone should be considered a voice-leading error.

title: VI. Rounding Fractional Scores
stimulusHtml:
VI. Rounding fractional scores

Round scores that end in 1/2 point up with one exception: round 33 1/2 points down to 33.
descriptions:
Student response earns none of the available points.
